args: You're in high spirits today, Cleo.\nWhat's that in your hand?
It's a very famous sort of good luck charm\nthat I was fortunate enough to find in town\nearlier while I was shopping.
A priest makes them by hand,\nso they sell out very quickly.
Birds are a symbol of the\nIlian Church, right?
Don't the wings symbolize how it delivers\nprayers to the goddess?
That's right. Supposedly if you leave it\nnear a window and let it bathe in the\nmoonlight, you will have good luck.
Heh. Sounds like someone in the Church\nis getting rich off these babies.
How could you say such a thing?!\nGood luck will never find you\nif that is your mindset.
Don't you worryâ€”I never skip my morning\nor evening prayers; I've got the goddess's\nblessings in spades.
*sigh* Must you always be so obnoxious?
{player_name}, I shall pray\ntonight for your happiness as well.\n
I hope your prayers reach the goddess.
Fire! Someone, help! There's a fire!
I'm fine, but a fire just broke out\nnear the window!
Stay back! I'll put it out!
I'm glad we stopped it from spreading.
But why would a fire start here\nin the first place?
Looks like we got ourselves a rat.\nBut don't worryâ€”I've got 'em!
Sorry I didn't help with the fire\nby the way, but I had my hands\nfull chasing down this scumbag.
Now tell us what you know, pal!\nWhat's your business here?!
Oh, you're gonna talk, my friend.\nOne way or another.

You're trespassing in a prince's castle
that happens to be short of decorations.
I'm thinking your head on a pike would
be a great place to start...
Cor, I gots no interest in the castle!\nI swears it!
Then talk before I pull out your tongue\nand use it to make up my own story!
I was just told to follow whoever\nbought that bird ornament!
Then if trouble broke out, I was s'posed\nto steal whatever ain't nailed down.\nIt's just a job, I swears it!
IF trouble broke out, is it?\nSo the fire wasn't your doing?
That's right! If nothing happened,\nI was s'posed to come back, I was.
Just some hoodlum type what I met\nwanderin' around town.
Said a merchant of some kind asked him\nto find a guy what wasn't afraid to dirty\nup his hands a little, yeah?
This is getting more confusing\nby the minute.
For starters, I'm gonna take this guy into\ntown in the morning and turn him in.
While I'm there, I'll look into his story,\nand... Hmm? What's that black lump\nyou're holding, {player_name}?
It looks like that fire started with this\nornament Cleo bought.
I felt so fortunate when I found it, too.
A charred ornament and a suspicious\nburglar? This is really getting fishy.

In the morning, Curran took the burglar into town
to hand him over. After doing so, he began asking
around and discovered that similar crimes had
been happening elsewhere.
In the dead of night, fire would break out,\nthen valuables would disappear in the\nensuing chaos.
Furthermore, a charred ornament would always\nbe found at the scene of the fire.
...So that's the gist of what's been\ngoing down around town.
Then the ornament I bought\nis a fake sold by thieves?
Yep. Since the genuine ones are so rare,\nthe counterfeit market has exploded.
And some of themâ€”like the one Cleo\npurchasedâ€”seem to be rather dangerous.
The sellers tell people they bring good\nluck when you put 'em in moonlight.
But they're actually designed to ignite\nonce that moonlight hits 'em.
Then they hire a hoodlum to follow the\nbuyer home and steal what they can\nwhile the owners are occupied.
How could anyone take advantage of\npeople simply praying for the happiness\nof others like this?
We have to put a stop to this.
If this was just a standard counterfeiting\nring, it wouldn't be my business.
But they're doing this on the back of the\nChurch, which is a whole different story.
Then let's work together to stop them!
Later, at the hideout of the merchant\nselling the counterfeit ornaments...
What are you doing, you fool?! Hurry up\nand kill those meddlers already!
But there's only THREE of them!
You haven't seen these guys in action!\nEspecially the one with an axe whoâ€”
Just a passing inquisitorâ€”and I'll thank\nyou to keep my name out of your mouth.
You've been causing mischief with a\nsymbol of the Church, but that ends here!
Aaaah ha ha ha! Mischief? Hardly!\nI merely sell people what they want.
They have only themselves to blame if\ntheir own greed blinds them to the danger.
Can it, scumbag! Sure, you sold people\nfakes and they didn't realize it...
But the prayers people wanted them\nto carry were as real as can be!
You abused their hopes and dreams,\nand you're going to pay for it.
I'm going to mete out your punishment\nhere and now...
So if you want to beg for mercy,\ndo it to your counterfeit goods!\nMaybe the goddess will hear you.
You're all hat and no cattle, friend.\nIf it's a fight you want...you'll have it.
Time to bring the judgment, guys.
Thus were the thieves punished at Curran's hands.\nSeveral days later...
I'm sorry for all you went through, Cleo,\nbut I appreciate all of your helpâ€”so I\nbrought a little something for you.
A...bird ornament? Is this one real?
Real as can be. It's a token of thanks from\na local church. But I have no need of it.
So this is what a real one looks like...
Thank you, Curran. It seems I have another\nsoul to add to my list of prayers.
Told you I was covered for prayers,\nremember?\nSee you later, then.
Ornaments are inanimate objects.\nYou can pray to them all you like,\nbut they don't deliver anything.
Real or fake, that's not gonna change.\n...Not that there's any harm in it.
If entrusting their prayers to a statue helps\nfolks, then I say, let 'em pray.
